properties.name: Seat Light Control
properties.about: Transforming a street light control box into a bench

properties.name: LightWell
properties.about: Solar-powered public seat and planter that visualizes Boston's stormwater systems through LED lights connected to real-time groundwater sensors
properties.authors: Michelle Laboy, Joshua Fiedler, Seth Wiseman

properties.name: LightWell v2*
properties.about: Building off of the original LightWell project, this is a citizen science project using sensor-connected well caps and a mobile app to continuously collect and visualize groundwater data citywide
properties.authors: Michelle Laboy, Joshua Fiedler, Seth Wiseman, Boston Groundwater Trust

properties.name: Tidraphone
properties.about: Interactive tidal vibraphone installed on Congress Street Bridge that plays different melodies based on tide levels, using sound to engage the public with climate change and sea level rise
properties.authors: Kate Balug, Dana Busch, Alyson Fletcher, Emily Goldsmith, Conor MacDonald, Joseph Wight, Noah Vawter

properties.name: Stairs of Fabulousness
properties.about: Temporary rainbow staircase installation at Boston City Hall using fluorescent grit tape to improve safety, visibility, and fabulousness

properties.name: Portable Reading Room
properties.about: Mobile library on the Rose Kennedy Greenway
properties.authors: Leslie Davol, Sam Davol, Höweler + Yoon Architecture, Diana Limbach Lempel

properties.name: Franklin St. Neighborway
properties.location: Allston, Franklin St. and Fern St.
properties.about: Street Mural on Franklin St. in Allston
properties.authors: Mark Chase, Michelle Moon, Ross Miller, Jessica Robertson, Galen Mook, Emma Walters, Harry Mattison, John Powell, Lea Beaulieu, Paola Ferrer, Tim McHale

properties.name: Night Garden
properties.about: Activating Boston's community gardens with outdoor light installations for evening gatherings and artistic expression, extending garden hours

properties.name: Public Stage
properties.about: Installation of a sound system at Symphony Community Park to stream live performances from the Boston Symphony Orchestra  with synchronized light displays during summer and fall evenings.
properties.authors: Liat Racin, Matan Mayer, Mariko Davidson, Christiana Usenza, Alon Dagan

properties.name: Public Radio
properties.about: Giant radio for all at District Hall
properties.authors: New American Public Art (Dan Sternof Beyer, Greg MacGlashing, Bevan Weissman) and Andrew Ringler

properties.name:
Real People, Real Stories:
Mattapan
properties.about: Poem and Photography series in the windows of the Mattapan Branch Library

properties.name: Kit of Parks
properties.about: Portable kit of parts to build a park that unpacks in under five minutes to activate underutilized public spaces

properties.name: Radiant Forest
properties.about: Translucent colored screens on a bus shelter creating a dappled forest canopy effect that filters light and evolves throughout the day and seasons
properties.authors: Sasaki (Ryan Collier, Chris Freda, Anthony Lawson, Jhanéa Williams)

properties.name: Mystery Map
properties.about: Sidewalk mural as a puzzle in East Boston

properties.name: Ecosonic Playground
properties.about: Musical installation featuring instruments inspired by Vietnamese folk traditions installed near corner school bus stops

properties.name: Play and Yay!
properties.about: 520-square-foot painted sidewalk installation at the Trotter School designed as a large-scale coloring book where visitors add chalk designs and follow interconnected paths
properties.authors: Lisa Jeanne Graf, Mayor's Mural Crew

properties.name: Words on the Street
properties.about: Three spinning prize wheels with bilingual words that combine to create phrases for creative play and language learning in Roslindale

properties.name: Celebrate + Activate

properties.authors: Melissa Nussbaum, Ayako Maruyama, Maria Hendricks, Raquel Saenz, Adilson Barros, Dana Watkins, Prema Bangera, Sonya Joyner

properties.name: Cross Pollination
properties.about: "Pollinator-Pots" combined native flowers for pollinators with sculptural shade structures featuring poetic messages to connect gardeners, wildlife, and residents
properties.authors: Claudia Paraschiv, Annie Scott, Azia Carle

properties.name: All Who are Hungry
properties.about: Community dinner series with custom dinner table at a community garden

properties.name: Grow Up Curious
properties.about: Interactive sensory garden featuring immersive single-sense planters that teach children and families about plants through playful exploration

properties.name: Pollinator Summer
properties.about: Interactive exhibit and event series at Fenway Victory Gardens educating visitors about pollinators and why they are essential to ecosystems and food systems

properties.name: Stories from the Garden
properties.about: Event series preserving neighborhood oral histories through songwriting workshops, writing workshops, community murals, and a live-recorded open mic performance
properties.authors: Anaís Azul, Dzidor Azaglo, Kim Barzola, Hassan Ghanny, Sofía Perez, Stephanie Houten, Cameron Hawkins

properties.name: Wheel'n Around
properties.about: Mobile installation using modified wheelbarrows and pallets to create gathering spaces that spark creativity and teach people about urban agriculture

properties.name: Little by Little
properties.about: Tiered wetland installation inspired by the Rube Goldberg-Machine: imagine a three-part raised rain garden that visualizes water filtration processes through plexiglass windows, highlighting green infrastructure's role in mitigating flooding and heat.
